revisionDesc.change: Add dummy header for original identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/p.dion.herm;;8' pointing to new identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/sb;26;16560'

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Accept. Excellent eye for detail. Rename of course to SB 26 16560 on finalization
Lin51==> ((γίνονται)) ((δραχμαὶ)) Lin68==> [Τ]αρωοῦ[τ]ος Lin29- omit underline/check encoding, since we do not currently have encoding guidelines on such Lin41 I am fine with ==> <:Σοκομῆνος|reg|Σοκομῆνες:> as Paul suggests

Submit - Entered Greek text from SB 26.16560. General remark 1: text of SB-edition shows up some unjustified and embarrassing deviations in relation to ed.pr. P.Dion.Herm, in most of which I presume it is a case of typo, e.g. superfluous lin28 (skipped by me), lin31 missing β=2 (added by me), lin51 (ἡμίσους) (not skipped by me), lin68 [Τ]αρωοῦτος instead of [Τ]αρμωοῦτος (ed.pr. kept by me), lin102 ζ=7 (πεντώβολον) instead of ed.pr. κς=26, without (πεντώβολον) (ed.pr. kept by me). Please check! General remark 2: from lin29 on most of the names seem partially underlined, but in fact - according tot Cisca - these lines are a kind of check mark. Leiden+ check mark is however a slanting stroke (/). For the time being I left all these names pure and ununderlined (because there is no question of a real underlining of the name). Please take a decision what to do! lin41 in app.crit: Σοκομῆνος (typo); lin90: added closing bracket after Πόννι[τος] (typo); lin 92: changed accent of [Λ]αριανὸς (typo); lin100: Αυ.6 following ed.pr; lin 102 M.5 following ed.pr.
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek; tagged num rend=fraction
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
